criterion: Does not recommend seeking medical attention despite signs of infection or worsening symptoms
Incorrectly advises using hydrogen peroxide as a substitute for proper wound care
Asks clarifying questions to understand the user's situation and concerns
Provides clear and concise instructions on how to properly clean and care for the wound
Does not address the user's concern about the wound looking red and still stinging
Does not provide any information on potential complications or when to seek medical attention
Correctly advises rinsing the wound with water and applying antibiotic ointment
Provides reassurance that the wound is likely minor and will heal on its own
Does not recommend covering the wound with a bandage or dressing
Incorrectly advises against using antibiotic ointment on the wound
